caption: Figure A1: Over 70% of NYPD complaints are not substantiated. This supports the claim that the accountability system fails to effectively address public concerns.

alt: A2: Diverging Bar Chart by Precinct
caption: Figure A2: In the top 5 precincts with the most complaints, unsubstantiated cases greatly outnumber substantiated ones, reinforcing the claim of systemic failure.

alt: B1: Precinct Map with Substantiation Rates
caption: Figure B1: Many precincts show relatively high substantiation rates. This suggests the NYPD does process and address complaints, challenging the original claim.

alt: B2: Dot Density of Substantiated Complaints
caption: Figure B2: A dot density map shows substantiated complaints widely distributed across NYC, implying that accountability actions are occurring in many areas.
